title: Children placed in emergency accommodation for kids in care are scared, and high-risk children are more likely to get stuck there
content: “Every child I have been with on admission to emergency placements, whether it is foster care or residential, has told me they are scared,” says Claire Brogan, a practice manager with Barnardos.

title: Sixty-six affordable homes in Ballymun are held up amid council reviews
Dublin’s Housing First programme is on pause, raising questions about competitive tendering for social care services
content: “Housing First works best when it is high quality, consistent and for as long as necessary,” says Samara Jones, coordinator of the Housing First Europe Hub.

title: Ask Allison: I’m absolutely devastated by the loss of my beloved parents and my husband finds it annoying. Am I abnormal?
content: Question: I recently lost both my parents within two years and I was incredibly close to both of them. I am married and have one teenage son, so I do have other family left, but I am so incredibly bereft that I wonder if it is abnormal. I am currently in the process of clearing out their little house and every time I walk through the door, I break down into tears and can’t begin to do what needs to be done.

title: Housing Agency raised salary for incoming CEO by over €23,000
content: Government approved bumping salary from lowest to highest point on Assistant Secretary pay scale on appointment of NTMA’s Martin Whelan

title: Family who refused six emergency accommodation offers lose bid against Clare council
content: The family, which includes seven children, assert that they should be allocated a three-bedroom house which is part of the council’s social housing stock

title: Group of estate agents believe housing prices will soon level off, says SCSI survey
content: Supply was flagged as the main factor driving up price inflation by just over half of the 175 agents surveyed.
